title: Evening showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Uva and Eastern provinces and in Mullaittivu district after 2.00 p.m.

title: GMOA calls off planned strike
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to call off their island-wide token strike, which was scheduled to commence at 8:00 a.m. today (August 25) in all government hospitals.

title: Shooting incident reported in Wellampitiya
byline: A shooting incident has been reported early this morning (25) at a lodge in the Kittampahuwa area of Wellampitiya.

title: US National Guard troops in Washington to begin carrying weapons, officials say
byline: U.S. National Guard troops patrolling the streets of Washington D.C. as part of what President Donald Trump said was his crackdown on crime will begin carrying weapons on Sunday night, two officials said.

title: DIG Uditha Liyanage arrested by CID
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has arrested Colombo Range Deputy Inspector General of Police (DIG) Uditha Liyanage in connection with the allegations of treasure hunting levelled against his wife, police said.

title: Container truck collision with tractor kills 8, injures 43 in India
byline: At least eight people, including two women and a child, were killed, and around 43 others injured when a container truck collided with a tractor carrying devotees in India’s northern state of Uttar Pradesh early on Monday, police said.

title: Govt’s large-scale development projects to begin in Sept – Minister
byline: Minister Bimal Ratnayake announced that the government’s large-scale development projects will commence in September.

title: NTC to introduce unified timetable for long-distance bus services
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has decided to operate long-distance passenger transport buses, both by the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) and private companies, under a unified timetable.

title: Bands pull out from festival after group ‘cut off’ over Palestine flag
byline: Several bands have pulled out from the Victorious music festival just hours before their scheduled performances, following claims by Irish folk group The Mary Wallopers that they were “cut off” for displaying a Palestinian flag.

title: Erik Solheim calls for immediate release of ex-President Ranil
byline: Former Norwegian special peace envoy to Sri Lanka, Erik Solheim, has expressed strong concerns over the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe and has called for his immediate release.

title: Three suspects arrested over Boralesgamuwa shooting incident
byline: Three suspects have been arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting the shooting incident that killed a youth on Malani Bulathsinhala Road in Boralesgamuwa.

title: Suspect arrested for defrauding over Rs. 150 mln by promising jobs in Korea
byline: A suspect who defrauded large sums of money by promising foreign employment opportunities in South Korea has been arrested by officers of the Colombo Central Crime Investigation Bureau (CCIB) in the Thalikulam area.

title: Two individuals arrested over Borella shooting
byline: Two individuals have been arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting the shooting reported in the Kader Nana Watte area in Borella on August 22, police stated.

title: Newly appointed IGP calls on Defence Secretary
byline: The newly appointed Inspector General of Police, Priyantha Weerasooriya has paid a courtesy call on the Secretary of the Ministry Defence, Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd), today at the Ministry of Defence.

title: “Moving towards dictatorship “: - Opposition leaders issue statement on arrest of ex-President Ranil
byline: Leaders of opposition political parties have jointly issued a statement regarding the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe by the Criminal Investigation Department.

title: India will buy oil from where it gets ‘the best deal’ - envoy to Russia
byline: India will continue to buy oil from wherever it “gets the best deal” in order to protect the interests of its 1.4 billion people, the country’s ambassador to Russia has said.

title: Sajith visits Ranil at hospital again, says he expects court to issue independent ruling tomorrow
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa visited former President Ranil Wickremesinghe who is currently receiving treatment at the Colombo National Hospital once again this morning.

title: Vietnam evacuates tens of thousands, shuts airports as Typhoon Kajiki approaches
byline: The Vietnamese government said Typhoon Kajiki is expected to be as powerful as Typhoon Yagi, which battered the country less than a year ago, killing about 300 people.

title: Diplomats in Colombo informed about arrest of ex-President Ranil Wickremesinghe
byline: Foreign diplomats in Colombo have been informed yesterday regarding the arrest and imprisonment of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe.

title: Spotify flags price rises as it introduces new services, FT reports
byline: Spotify will raise prices as it invests in new features and targets 1 billion users, the Financial Times reported on Sunday citing the music streaming provider’s Co-President and Chief Business Officer Alex Norstrom.

title: Shooter and motorcyclist arrested over Gandara shooting incident
byline: The alleged shooter and the motorcyclist have been arrested in connection with the shooting incident in the Kapugama area of the Gandara Police Division, police confirmed.

title: SC begins hearing petitions against bill to revoke privileges of former Presidents
byline: The Supreme Court today (25) commenced hearing petitions filed seeking a ruling that the provisions of the bill presented to Parliament by the government to revoke the privileges of former presidents are unconstitutional.

title: Colombo HC to consider bail requests filed by Aluthgamage & Nalin Fernando in Sept
byline: The Colombo High Court today (25) ordered that the bail petitions filed by former ministers Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernando be taken up again on September 23 for confirmation of facts, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Jerry Adler, who starred in The Sopranos, dies aged 96
byline: Actor Jerry Adler, best known for playing consigliere Herman ‘Hesh’ Rabkin in The Sopranos, has died aged 96.
